flawed_nl_solution:
After 30 days, there will be enough food left to sustain 300 people for 90 days - 30 days = 70 days.
After the 100 people leave, there will be 300-100 = <<300-100=200>>200 people left.
The 200 people will eat 200/300 = 200/300 as much food as the original group of people in the castle.
The 70 days' worth of food will last this smaller group for 70 days / (200/300) = <<70/(200/300)=105>>105 more days.
#### 105

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 60, not 70. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
